alert.note: Alert for Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 12:07PM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following counties, Franklin and Stephens. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1205 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated a lessening threat for additional heavy rain. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area due to the heavy runoff. Between 3.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
